intro: Astracantha caspica, commonly known as the Caspian Astracantha, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Astracantha caspica is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
